# Anti-Scam Song — 《Link Don't Press Randomly》

To further promote work of preventing fraud, we launched an anti-fraud song sung jointly by singer Mr. Ng Kwong and Deputy Chief Executive Mr. Kwan Kuk-hing of the Monetary Authority, reminding users “假Link咪當真，唔好俾人昆”, and to properly keep sensitive personal data and credit card data. The effectiveness of the cross-media promotional activity has been affirmed, achieving international promotion honors.

Deputy Chief Executive Mr. Ng Kwan Hang participated in the performance of the anti-fraud song.

Cross-media activities strengthen public awareness of fraud prevention.

# Cross-boundary financial opportunities video series

The Monetary Authority and a local video station jointly produce the 《Cross-boundary Financial Opportunities》 video series to support users to further understand how Wealth Management Connect (WMC) provides opportunities and facilitated convenience for retail investors in cross-border investment. The short video to promote “Wealth Management Connect” in a humorous and engaging manner.

To enhance the financial knowledge of students, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority is collaborating with various related institutions to hold the “Hong Kong Financial Championship”. This activity enters its tenth year in 2024, with the theme "Next-gen Financial Talent," aims to let students gain an early understanding of innovation, financial technology, Artificial Intelligence, and future developments and trends, as well as promote students adhering to sustainable development and environment, social and governance principles.

Championship first part is an online quiz Championship, testing participating students' money management knowledge and their understanding of popular financial topics. # 意見

茲證明我已審計列載於第209至309頁外匯基金及其附屬公司（「集團」）的財務報表，該等財務報表包括外匯基金及集團於2024年12月31日的資產負債表與截至該日止年度的收支帳目、全面收益表、權益變動表和現金流量表，以及財務報表的附註，包括重大會計政策資料。

我已按照行政長官在《外匯基金條例》第7條下所發出的指示及審計署的審計準則進行審計。我根據該等準則而須承擔的責任，詳載於本報告「審計師就財務報表審計而須承擔的責任」部分。根據該等準則，我獨立於集團，並已按該等準則履行其他道德責任。我相信，我所獲得的審計憑證是充足和適當地為我的審計意見提供基礎。

# 關鍵審計事項

關鍵審計事項是根據我的專業判斷，對截至2024年12月31日止年度財務報表的審計最為重要的事項。我對整體財務報表進行審計及形成意見時處理了這些事項，而我不會對這些事項提供單獨的意見。

# 按公平值列帳的金融資產及金融負債的估值

請參閱財務報表附註2.5、2.6及37.1。

於2024年12月31日，集團按公平值列帳的金融資產共 39,151.17 億港元，金融負債共 13,862.99 億港元。

86%的該等金融資產及所有該等金融負債的公平值為相同資產或負債於活躍市場的報價（第1級參數），或是以估值方法估計，而所用的參數是以可觀察市場數據為基礎（第2級參數）。

其餘14%的該等金融資產的公平值，是以估值方法估計，而所用的參數並非以可觀察市場數據為基礎（第3級參數）。有關金融資產共5,522.51億港元，主要包括非上市投資基金。

鑑於所涉數額龐大及涉及估計，按公平值列帳的金 融資產及金融負債的估值屬關鍵審計事項。

就按公平值列帳的金融資產及金融負債的估值，審計程序包括：

- 了解不同類別金融資產及金融負債的估值程序，包括相關監控措施；

- 評價及測試監控措施，包括電腦系統的相關應用程式監控措施；

- 就金融資產及金融負債的估值、存在、權利與責任及完整性取得函證；

- 若使用市場報價，根據獨立來源核實價格；

- 若所用估值方法的參數是以可觀察市場數據為基礎，評價估值方法是否適合及有關假設是否合理，以及根據獨立來源核實參數；及

- 若所用估值方法的參數並非以可觀察市場數據為基礎，評價估值方法是否適合，以及有關假設與參數是否合理。

# 按公平值列帳的投資物業的估值

請參閱財務報表附註2.11、17及18。

集團的投資物業按公平值列帳，於2024年12月31日共值211.32億港元。集團亦於聯營公司及合營公司擁有權益，該等公司主要業務為持有海外投資物業。不論是由集團直接持有或由聯營公司或合營公司持有，該等投資物業的公平值均主要根據獨立專業估值師的估值釐定。該等估值涉及重大判斷及估計，包括所用的估值方法及假設。

就按公平值列帳的投資物業的估值，審計程序包括：

- 獲取及審視由集團直接持有或由聯營公司或合營公司持有的投資物業的估值報告，並核實公平值是根據有關估值報告所列的估值釐定；

- 評估估值師的獨立性及資歷；及

- 評價估值方法是否適合，以及有關假設與參數是否合理。

# 其他資料

我對財務報表的意見並不涵蓋其他資料，我亦不對其他資料發表任何形式的鑒證結論。

就財務報表審計而言，我有責任閱讀其他資料，從而考慮其他資料是否與財務報表或我在審計過程中得悉的情況有重大矛盾，或者似乎存有重大錯誤陳述。基於我已執行的工作，如果我認為其他資料存有重大錯誤陳述，我需要報告該事實。在這方面，我沒有任何報告。

# 金融管理專員及外匯基金諮詢委員會轄下的審核委員會就財務報表而須承擔的責任

金融管理專員須負責按照香港會計師公會頒布的《香港財務報告會計準則》及行政長官在《外匯基金條例》第7條下所發出的指示擬備真實而中肯的財務報表，及落實其認為必要的內部控制， 使財務報表不存有因欺詐或錯誤而導致的重大錯誤陳述。

在擬備財務報表時，金融管理專員須負責評估集團持續經營的能力，以及在適用情況下披露與持續經營有關的事項，並以持續經營作為會計基礎。

外匯基金諮詢委員會轄下的審核委員會負責監督集團的財務報告過程。

# 審計師就財務報表審計而須承擔的責任

我的目標是就整體財務報表是否不存有任何因欺詐或錯誤而導致的重大錯誤陳述取得合理保證，並發出包括我意見的審計師報告。合理保證是高水平的保證，但不能確保按審計署審計準則進行的審計定能發現所存有的任何重大錯誤陳述。錯誤陳述可以由欺詐或錯誤引起，如果合理預期它們個別或滙總起來可能影響財務報表使用者所作出的經濟決定，則會被視作重大錯誤陳述。

在根據審計署審計準則進行審計的過程中，我會運用專業判斷並秉持專業懷疑態度。我亦會：

- 識別和評估因欺詐或錯誤而導致財務報表存有重大錯誤陳述的風險；設計及執行審計程序以應對這些風險；以及取得充足和適當的審計憑證，作為我意見的基礎。由於欺詐可能涉及串謀、偽造、蓄意遺漏、虛假陳述，或凌駕內部控制的情況，因此未能發現因欺詐而導致重大錯誤陳述的風險，較未能發現因錯誤而導致者為高；

- 了解與審計相關的內部控制，以設計適當的審計程序。然而，此舉並非旨在對集團內部控制的有效性發表意見；

- 評價金融管理專員所採用的會計政策是否恰當，以及其作出的會計估計和相關資料披露是否合理；

- 評價財務報表的整體列報方式、結構和內容，包括披露資料，以及財務報表是否中肯反映交易和事項；及

-計劃並執行集團審計，以就集團中實體或業務單位的財務資料獲取充足和適當的審計憑證，作為對財務報表形成意見的基礎。我負責指導、監督和審視為進行集團審計而履行的審計工作。我對我的審計意見承擔全部責任。

我會與外匯基金諮詢委員會轄下的審核委員會溝通計劃的審計範圍和時間以及重大審計發現等事項，包括我在審計期間識別出內部控制的任何重大缺陷。

我亦會向外匯基金諮詢委員會轄下的審核委員會提交聲明，說明我已符合有關獨立性的相關道德要求，並與他們溝通所有被合理認為可能會影響我獨立性的關係和其他事項，以及在適用的情況下，相關的防範措施。

# Audit Office Report

# Hong Kong’s Special Administrative Region Government audit and assessment office.

# Independent auditor’s report to the Financial Secretary.

# Advice

This certifies that I have audited the financial statements set out on pages 209 to 309 of the Exchange Fund and its subsidiaries (the Group), which include the balance sheet of the Exchange Fund and the group as at December 31, 2024, and the income and expenditure account, comprehensive gains table, equity movements table, and cash flow table for the year then ended, as well as the notes to the financial statements, including major accounting policy data.

I believe that the financial reports have already fairly and accurately reflected the financial condition of the Exchange Fund and the Group as at December 31, 2024, and the financial performance and cash flows for the year to that date, in accordance with the Hong Kong Association’s Hong Kong Financial Reporting Standards, and have been properly prepared in accordance with the instructions issued under section 7 of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Chapter 66) by the Chief Executive.

# The basis of advice.

I have conducted the audit in accordance with the instructions issued by the Chief Executive under section 7 of the Exchange Fund Ordinance and the audit Standards of the Audit Commission. The responsibility that I shall bear according to those Standards is detailed in the section of this report, "Auditor's Responsibility for the Audit of the Financial Report." According to those Standards, I am independent of the group, and have already fulfilled other ethical responsibilities in accordance with those Standards. I believe that the audit evidence I have obtained is sufficient and appropriately provides the basis for my opinion.

# Key audit issues

Key audit issues are, based on my professional judgment, the most critical matters regarding the audit of the annual financial statements as at December 31, 2024. I have addressed these issues when auditing the overall financial statements and forming an opinion, and I will not provide separate advice on these issues.

# Financial assets and liabilities valued at fair value.

See financial table 2, 2.6, and 3.

On December 31, 2024, the Group's financial assets valued at fair value totaled 39,151.17 billion Hong Kong dollars, and financial liabilities totaled 13,862.99 billion Hong Kong dollars.

86% of the financial assets and liabilities’ fair value is the same as the quoted price of those assets or liabilities in an active market (Level 1 inputs), or is estimated using a valuation method, with inputs based on observable market data (Level 2 inputs).

The remaining 14% of these financial assets’ fair value is estimated, and the inputs used are not based on observable market data (Level 3 parameters). These financial assets total HK$5,522.51 billion, primarily including non-listed investment fund(s).

Given the large amount and involving estimation, the valuation of financial assets and financial liabilities accounted for at fair value is a critical audit matter.

Regarding the valuation of financial assets and liabilities accounted for at fair value, audit procedures include:

Understand the valuation procedures of different categories of financial assets and liabilities, including related controls.

Assessment and testing of controls, including measures for monitoring related applications within the system.

Regarding the valuation, existence, rights and responsibilities, and completeness of financial assets and liabilities, obtain confirmation.

If using Market prices, verify the prices according to independent sources.

If the inputs of the valuation method are based on observable market data, the assessment of whether the valuation method is suitable and whether the related assumptions are reasonable, and verifying the inputs based on independent sources; and

If the inputs of the valuation method are not based on observable market data, is the assessment of the valuation method suitable, and are the related assumptions and inputs reasonable?

# Valuation of investment properties accounted for at fair value.

See financial table note 2.11, 17 and 18.

The Group’s investment properties are stated at fair value, with a total value of HK$211.32 billion on December 31, 2024. The Group also has interests in associated companies and joint ventures, the main business of which is to have overseas investment properties. Whether held directly by the Group or by associated companies or joint ventures, the fair value of these investment properties is primarily determined by independent professional estimation, harmonise. These estimations involve significant judgment and estimation, including the valuation methods and assumptions used.

The valuation of investment properties accounted for at fair value includes audit procedures.

To effect reporting and review of the valuation reports of investment properties directly held by the Group or held by linked companies or joint ventures, and to verify that the fair value is determined based on the valuations listed in the related valuation reports.

Assess the independent value and qualifications of valuers; and

Assessment of valuation methods, related assumptions, and inputs is necessary to determine their suitability.

# Other data

The Monetary Authority is responsible for other data. Other data includes all data within the Hong Kong Monetary Authority’s 2024 annual report, but does not include financial statements and my auditor's report.

My advice on the financial table does not cover other data, and I will not publish any form of verification conclusions regarding other data.

Regarding financial audit, I have a responsibility to read other data, to consider whether that data is materially inconsistent with the financial report or the situation I ascertained during the audit, or appears to have material misstatements. Based on the work I have executed, if I believe that other data have material misstatements, I need to report that fact. In this regard, I have no reporting.

# The Monetary Authority and Advisory Committees under the Exchange Fund Fund’s audits committee shall bear responsibility for the financial table.

The Monetary Authority shall be responsible for preparing true and fair financial reports in accordance with the Hong Kong Association’s Standards issued by the Hong Kong certified public accountant(s) Association and instructions issued by the Chief Executive under section 7 of the Exchange Fund Ordinance, and for implementing internal controls that it considers necessary, to enable the financial reports to not exist having material misstatements resulting from fraud or error.

When preparing financial statements, the Monetary Authority shall be responsible for assessing the group's viable operating capacity, and disclose issues related to continued operating conditions as applicable, and use continued operating as the accounting basis.

The Exchange Fund Advisory Committee’s audits committee is responsible for supervision of the Group’s financial reporting.

# Auditors shall bear responsibilities for the financial audit.

My objective is to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the overall financial reporting does not exist any material misstatements caused by fraud or error, and provides an audit report including my advice. Reasonable assurance is a high standard of assurance, but cannot ensure that an audit conducted in accordance with auditing Standards can detect all existing material misstatements. Misstatements can arise from fraud or error, and will be considered material if they are reasonably likely to influence economic decisions made by users of the financial reports.

In the process of conducting an audit according to the audit Standards of the Audit Commission, I will apply professional judgment and maintain a professional attitude. I will also:

# 1 business

The Monetary Authority, in its capacity as the manager of the Exchange Fund, grants powers according to the Financial Secretary, and manages the fund in accordance with the provisions of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Chapter 66). The fund’s main business is to defend the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate and maintain the stability and integrity of Hong Kong’s monetary and financial system(s).

The fund’s asset(s) are managed through four distinct portfolios: Support Portfolio, Investment Portfolio, Long-Term Growth Portfolio, and Strategic Asset Portfolio. According to Hong Kong’s Exchange Fund Fund system, the asset(s) of the Support Portfolio are fully matched with the monetary foundation. The Investment Portfolio primarily invests in bond(s) and stock markets of countries that are members of the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development. The Long-Term Growth Portfolio holds private equity and real estate investment. The Strategic Asset Portfolio holds stock of Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (Hong Kong SAR) government purchased for strategic purpose(s) and are included in the fund’s accounts of Hong Kong Exchange and Clearing Limited.
